file_content.text: I'm starting to wonder what we're doing on this planet.
Fauler says we need that data to get any further.
Is it safe? Are they dead?
Why were those people attacking us?
What was that?
It's--they were--sorry, I've got to... just keep breathing. Okay.
They're gone. You're fine.
Relax, the time to be useful is over.
You weren't much help.
I--I thought I was dead for sure. I... I've gotta... whew... breathing, jus--jus--just keep breathing....
My name is Kamus Orden. I used to be an accountant.
My company sent those men to kill me. It's a Czerka Corporation severance package....
What happened in here? Come on, Kamus, you know how I feel about corpses in my work space.
You! You were supposed to be here! You swore I'd be protected!
Sorry, Kamus. As an official "Republic representative," I have to at least look like I'm being diplomatic with the locals.
You're the man I spoke to earlier. Care to explain?
Fauler--we've met.
Huh. I take it you saved Kamus. Thanks.
I'm losing patience.
Kamus would be dead if not for me.
Be grateful I was here.
Yeah, I gathered that. Kamus isn't exactly the fastest gun in the galaxy.
You're probably catching on that we're a bit understaffed--and that I'm not really a bureaucrat.
It took you a month to tell me that.
This is a Republic Strategic Information Service project--a covert operation.
It's a major assignment. Mystery, corporate scandal and incredibly dangerous tech--with a lot of lives on the line. You could make all the difference.
I hope the Strategic Information Service doesn't plan to keep me in the dark.
You should have been upfront.
Sorry. Old habits are hard to break.
It seems the Force has brought us together.
This must be destiny.
Give the Force my regards, then.
Give me a briefing, sir, and I'll get the job done.
What's the situation?
That makes this my lucky day. Tatooine's, too.
You know how to make a sale, I'll give you that.
Nice speech.
You can count on me.
Just talk.
This all started when Kamus forwarded some Czerka Corporation documents to his local Republic security office.
Now, we've been watching Czerka awhile--they've buried a lot of scandals, done a lot of dirty deals--but this was something special.
The documents were mixed in with old expense reports. They described a billion-credit research facility for "the study of a type-seven device."
"Type-seven device" being Czerka shorthand for "device capable of eliminating a planetary population."
A corporation has a weapon that can destroy a planet?
That's something.
Destroy a planet, or maybe just kill everyone on it. Makes a difference to the right kind of megalomaniac.
This is why Czerka wants you dead?
That explains the assassins.
Yes, that's right.
I don't believe it.
I didn't want to believe it myself... I mean, I knew Czerka sold weapons, but this?
Turns out they abandoned the project decades ago. We're lucky to know the facility was here on Tatooine.
So, Kamus and I came to find whatever doomsday device Czerka had and keep them from burying the evidence--and us.
Why would Czerka leave behind such an expensive project?
They abandoned it?
That's worrisome.
If the device is on Tatooine, then what are we waiting around for?
So let's go, already.
From what we could find, sounds like the device went haywire, and Czerka bailed rather than try and clean it up.
Now, clues to Czerka's operation have been extremely hard to come by. Impossible, as a matter of fact.
We've got one avenue left, but it's too dangerous for Kamus or me--an old compound Czerka used as a staging area.
What's in the compound?
Compound, eh?
Tell me what I'm facing, and I'll be on my way.
It'll be my next destination.
Surely Czerka would've erased any evidence there as well.
How will that help?
It's a long shot. And that's not even the best part.
If it's far, I charge for travel expenses.
Do I have to walk?
We'll talk credits after you're done. Besides, you haven't even heard the best part.
I'll assault and seize the compound immediately, sir.
On my way.
Easy there, soldier. We just need someone to get inside and look around.
That's all you've got? Great.
That's it?
You're starting to sound like my boss. Yes, this is the best lead we have.
After Czerka left, the compound was taken over by a gang of Gamorrean raiders who, I discovered, don't appreciate visitors.
Still, judging by these dead guys here, you might be able to push past the Gamorreans and search Czerka's old storage archives--gather any data left.
Got it.
What is a Gamorrean, exactly?
Gamorreans?
Nasty humanoids, almost two meters tall. Brutal, but not very bright.
Remind me how I profit.
You'll have the satisfaction of serving our glorious Republic and saving innocent lives--not to mention the credits.
Be careful! Finding the files that Czerka left in that compound is important, but don't get killed.
Couldn't have said it better myself....
Aaaaah!
L--leave me alone! I haven't done anything to you!
You stole corporate documents, Kamus. Czerka doesn't take industrial sabotage lightly.
Contact! Military subject, likely armed!
Contact! Unidentified subject, possibly a collaborator!
You know the drill--no survivors, no leaks.
You're not killing anyone here.
I won't permit murder.
This lust for violence will be your undoing.
You're very quick to kill.
Look, I just took a wrong turn at the cantina....
Whoa, hold on!
Heh. Nice try.
I'm an officer in the Republic Army--stand down, now!
Nobody move!
Sorry, soldier. Today's not your day.
Huh?
Help me! Please, help!
If you want a fight, you've got it.
I'll take you down.
Open fire!
Aaaaah!
Contact! Subject is... subject is a Jedi! What are your orders, sir?
What? Who are you? I don't have anything to say to you!
